channel.title: Gluon gun effect
channel.description: After watching the video, I wondered if its possible to make the player stopped while he's firing the weapon. If not stop, moving with a speed between walking and sprinting (closer to walking). This idea came from the moment at the end of the video where is noticeable the strengh Gordon uses to only control the weapon, like it was a big firefighter's hose.

item.title: Gluon gun effect
item.dc:creator: Skilgannon
item.description:
baconeggs:

Don’t be silly, it’s been converted into an RPG. Gordon now has different attributes and can upgrade his weapons, as well as wander around the entire Black Mesa complex. Estimated play time: 2 months.

No no. It’s going to be a 2D side scrolling platformer in 16 colours only. The controls will be the arrows to move, space to jump and control to fire. Each level of the game will be set on an entire screen, and will consist of 32 levels. Objectives will include collecting crystals in the level, reflex based shooting puzzles, pixel perfect jumping, and block puzzles. There will also be hidden in each of the levels a large gem. Collecting these gems in all 32 levels will unlock a secret 33rd level in which Gordon is rewarded with an awesome smiley (:awesome , and cake.

item.title: Gluon gun effect
item.dc:creator: QuakerMan
item.description:
I was thinking about the gluon mechanics, and I thought it could be interesting to test a little inertia on the beam: so, if you turn around very fast, the beam has a little delay in the rotation. Nothing exagerated, just a little bit so you have to learn how to aim properly at distant moving targets
In the original HL the gluon had no drawbacks at all and was just the ultimate weapon, even better than the crossbow itself at long distance multiplayer feeling, I know in single the gluon gun is ok ]
